source: NIFC
calculation: National Preparedness Level on the day of the fire/day combination

source: Derived for this paper using FPA-FOD database from Short (2022)
calculation: Number of FPA-FOD events also active on the day of the fire/day combination

source: CalTrans [CRS Functional Classification]
calculation: Percentile of mean road density (meters per hectare) within polygon representing daily burn perimeter compared to same value calculated when that polygon is located in ~500 other locations within the fire's biome, but not where the fire burned (i.e., independent of fire)

source: Percentiles derived for this paper using USGS 3DEP
calculation: Percentile of spatial mean elevation within polygon representing daily burn perimeter compared to same value calculated when that polygon is located in ~500 other locations within the fire's biome, but not where the fire burned (i.e., independent of fire)

source: Calculation and percentiles derived for this paper using USGS 3DEP
calculation: Percentile of rumple index (calculated using algorithm of Jenness (2004)) of elevation values within polygon representing daily burn perimeter compared to same value calculated when that polygon is located in ~500 other locations within the fire's biome, but not where the fire burned (i.e., independent of fire)

source: Aggregated from Theobald et al., (2015) and percentiles derived for this paper [Conservation Science Partners 10 m NED Landforms]
calculation: Percentile of proportional cover of peak/ridge (neutral), peak/ridge (warm), peak/ridge (cool), cliff, and mountain/divide within polygon representing daily burn perimeter compared to same value calculated when that polygon is located in ~500 other locations within the fire's biome, but not where the fire burned (i.e., independent of fire)

source: Aggregated from Theobald et al., (2015) and percentiles derived for this paper [Conservation Science Partners 10 m NED Landforms]
calculation: Percentile of proportional cover of valleys and narrow valleys within polygon representing daily burn perimeter compared to same value calculated when that polygon is located in ~500 other locations within the fire's biome, but not where the fire burned (i.e., independent of fire)

source: Aggregated from Theobald et al., (2015) and percentiles derived for this paper [Conservation Science Partners 10 m NED Landforms]
calculation: Percentile of proportional cover of upper slope (warm) and lower slope (warm) within polygon representing daily burn perimeter compared to same value calculated when that polygon is located in ~500 other locations within the fire's biome, but not where the fire burned (i.e., independent of fire)

source: Aggregated from Theobald et al., (2015) and percentiles derived for this paper [Conservation Science Partners 10 m NED Landforms]
calculation: Percentile of proportional cover of upper slope (cool) and lower slope (cool) within polygon representing daily burn perimeter compared to same value calculated when that polygon is located in ~500 other locations within the fire's biome, but not where the fire burned (i.e., independent of fire)

source: Aggregated from Theobald et al., (2015) and percentiles derived for this paper [Conservation Science Partners 10 m NED Landforms]
calculation: Percentile of proportional cover of upper slope (neutral) and lower slope (neutral) within polygon representing daily burn perimeter compared to same value calculated when that polygon is located in ~500 other locations within the fire's biome, but not where the fire burned (i.e., independent of fire)

source: Aggregated from Theobald et al., (2015) and percentiles derived for this paper [Conservation Science Partners 10 m NED Landforms]
calculation: Percentile of proportional cover of upper slope (flat) and lower slope (flat) within polygon representing daily burn perimeter compared to same value calculated when that polygon is located in ~500 other locations within the fire's biome, but not where the fire burned (i.e., independent of fire)

source: Derived for this paper from Theobald et al., (2015) [Conservation Science Partners 10 m NED Landforms]
calculation: Percentile of Shannon-Wiener Index of the proportional cover of the 6 aggregated landform types [peak/ridge/cliff, valleys, slope (warm), slope (cool), slope (neutral), flat] within polygon representing daily burn perimeter compared to same value calculated when that polygon is located in ~500 other locations within the fire's biome, but not where the fire burned (i.e., independent of fire)

display_name:
Average N/S wind direction
(1 = FROM the north)
source: Daily summary derived for this paper from ERA5 Reanalysis Land
calculation: mean of cosine of hourly wind directions each day

display_name:
Average E/W wind direction
(1 = FROM the east)
source: Daily summary derived for this paper from ERA5 Reanalysis Land
calculation: mean of sine of hourly wind directions each day

display_name:
Wind direction
N/S variability
(1 = consistent FROM the north)
source: Daily summary derived for this paper from ERA5 Reanalysis Land
calculation: standard deviation of cosine of hourly wind directions each day

display_name:
Wind direction
E/W variability
(1 = consistent FROM the east)
source: Daily summary derived for this paper from ERA5 Reanalysis Land
calculation: standard deviation of sine of hourly wind directions each day

source: Daily summary and percentiles derived for this paper from ERA5 Reanalysis Land
calculation: minimum percentile of hourly sustained wind speed in a day compared to hourly VPD between 1979-01-01 and 2020-12-31

source: Daily summary and percentiles derived for this paper from ERA5 Reanalysis Land
calculation: maximum percentile of hourly sustained wind speed in a day compared to hourly VPD between 1979-01-01 and 2020-12-31

source: Daily summary and percentiles derived for this paper from ERA5 Reanalysis Land
calculation: minimum percentile of hourly relative humidity in a day compared to hourly VPD between 1979-01-01 and 2020-12-31

source: Daily summary and percentiles derived for this paper from ERA5 Reanalysis Land
calculation: maximum percentile of hourly relative humidity in a day compared to hourly VPD between 1979-01-01 and 2020-12-31

source: Daily summary and percentiles derived for this paper from ERA5 Reanalysis Land
calculation: minimum percentile of hourly temperature in a day compared to hourly VPD between 1979-01-01 and 2020-12-31

source: Daily summary and percentiles derived for this paper from ERA5 Reanalysis Land
calculation: maximum percentile of hourly temperature in a day compared to hourly VPD between 1979-01-01 and 2020-12-31

source: Calculations, daily summary, and percentiles derived for this paper from ERA5 Reanalysis Land
calculation: minimum percentile of hourly vapor pressure deficit in a day compared to hourly VPD between 1979-01-01 and 2020-12-31

source: Calculations, daily summary, and percentiles derived for this paper from ERA5 Reanalysis Land
calculation: maximum percentile of hourly vapor pressure deficit (VPD) in a day compared to hourly VPD between 1979-01-01 and 2020-12-31

source: Percentiles derived for this paper using data from Abatzoglou (2012) [GRIDMET using NFDRS fire danger index scale]
calculation: percentile of daily burning index (BI) compared to daily BI between 1981-01-01 and 2020-12-31

source: Percentiles derived for this paper using data from Abatzoglou (2012) [GRIDMET using NFDRS fire danger index scale]
calculation: percentile of daily energy release component (ERC) compared to daily ERC between 1981-01-01 and 2020-12-31

source: Percentiles derived for this paper using data from Abatzoglou (2012) [GRIDMET]
calculation: percentile of 100-hour fuel moisture (FM100) compared to daily FM100 between 1981-01-01 and 2020-12-31

source: Percentiles derived for this paper using data from Abatzoglou (2012) [GRIDMET]
calculation: percentile of 1000-hour fuel moisture (FM1000) compared to daily FM1000 between 1981-01-01 and 2020-12-31

source: Abatzoglou (2012) [GRIDMET]
calculation: standardized precipitation evapotranspiration index (SPEI) aggregated across prior 14 days

source: Abatzoglou (2012) [GRIDMET]
calculation: standardized precipitation evapotranspiration index (SPEI) aggregated across prior 30 days

source: Abatzoglou (2012) [GRIDMET]
calculation: standardized precipitation evapotranspiration index (SPEI) aggregated across prior 90 days

source: Abatzoglou (2012) [GRIDMET]
calculation: standardized precipitation evapotranspiration index (SPEI) aggregated across prior 180 days

source: Abatzoglou (2012) [GRIDMET]
calculation: standardized precipitation evapotranspiration index (SPEI) aggregated across prior 270 days

source: Abatzoglou (2012) [GRIDMET]
calculation: standardized precipitation evapotranspiration index (SPEI) aggregated across prior 1 year

source: Abatzoglou (2012) [GRIDMET]
calculation: standardized precipitation evapotranspiration index (SPEI) aggregated across prior 2 years

source: Abatzoglou (2012) [GRIDMET]
calculation: standardized precipitation evapotranspiration index (SPEI) aggregated across prior 5 years

source: Abatzoglou (2012) [GRIDMET]
calculation: Palmer Drought Severity Index (PDSI) z-score

source: Spatial summary and percentiles derived for this paper using Landsat surface reflectance
calculation: First, a per-pixel normalized difference vegetation index (NDVI; using near infrared and red surface reflectance) is calculated as a temporal mean across previous growing season (between day of year 152 to day of year 258 in the year before the fire) after cloud masking and applying Landsat Collection 2 scale/offset values. Then, the percentile of spatial mean NDVI within polygon representing daily burn perimeter compared to same value calculated when that polygon is located in ~500 other locations within the fire's biome, but not where the fire burned (i.e., independent of fire).

source: Calculation and percentiles derived for this paper using Landsat surface reflectance-derived NDVI
calculation: Percentile of rumple index (calculated using algorithm of Jenness (2004)) of NDVI values (multiplied by 100 for convenience) within polygon representing daily burn perimeter compared to same value calculated when that polygon is located in ~500 other locations within the fire's biome, but not where the fire burned (i.e., independent of fire)

source: Aggregated from US Forest Service Landscape Change Monitoring System (LCMS) Landcover and percentiles derived for this paper
calculation: Percentile of proportional cover of LCMS 'trees' landcover type one year prior to fire event within polygon representing daily burn perimeter compared to same value calculated when that polygon is located in ~500 other locations within the fire's biome, but not where the fire burned (i.e., independent of fire)

source: Aggregated from US Forest Service Landscape Change Monitoring System (LCMS) Landcover and percentiles derived for this paper
calculation: Percentile of proportional cover of LCMS 'shrubs' and 'shrubs/trees mix' landcover types one year prior to fire event within polygon representing daily burn perimeter compared to same value calculated when that polygon is located in ~500 other locations within the fire's biome, but not where the fire burned (i.e., independent of fire)

source: Aggregated from US Forest Service Landscape Change Monitoring System (LCMS) Landcover and percentiles derived for this paper
calculation: Percentile of proportional cover of LCMS 'grass/forb/herb', 'grass/forb/herb/trees mix', and 'grass/forb/herb/shrubs mix' landcover types one year prior to fire event within polygon representing daily burn perimeter compared to same value calculated when that polygon is located in ~500 other locations within the fire's biome, but not where the fire burned (i.e., independent of fire)

source: Aggregated from US Forest Service Landscape Change Monitoring System (LCMS) Landcover and percentiles derived for this paper
calculation: Percentile of proportional cover of LCMS 'barren', 'barren/trees mix', 'barren/shrubs mix', 'barren/grass/forb/herb mix', and 'snow or ice' landcover types one year prior to fire event within polygon representing daily burn perimeter compared to same value calculated when that polygon is located in ~500 other locations within the fire's biome, but not where the fire burned (i.e., independent of fire)

source: Calculation and percentiles derived for this paper using US Forest Service LCMS Landcover
calculation: Percentile of Shannon-Wiener Index of the proportional cover of the 4 aggregated LCMS landcover types [trees, shrubs, grass/forb/herb, barren] one year prior to fire event within polygon representing daily burn perimeter compared to same value calculated when that polygon is located in ~500 other locations within the fire's biome, but not where the fire burned (i.e., independent of fire)

display_name:
High severity fire fraction
(within 1-5 years ago)
source: Aggregated from DOI/USGS LANDFIRE Annual Disturbance and percentiles derived for this paper
calculation: Percentile of proportional cover of LANDFIRE high-severity fire occurring 1 to 5 years prior to fire/day combination within polygon representing daily burn perimeter compared to same value calculated when that polygon is located in ~500 other locations within the fire's biome, but not where the fire burned (i.e., independent of fire)

display_name:
High severity fire fraction
(within 6-10 years ago)
source: Aggregated from DOI/USGS LANDFIRE Annual Disturbance and percentiles derived for this paper
calculation: Percentile of proportional cover of LANDFIRE high-severity fire occurring 6 to 10 years prior to fire/day combination within polygon representing daily burn perimeter compared to same value calculated when that polygon is located in ~500 other locations within the fire's biome, but not where the fire burned (i.e., independent of fire)

display_name:
Low/moderate severity fire fraction
(within 1-5 years ago)
source: Aggregated from DOI/USGS LANDFIRE Annual Disturbance and percentiles derived for this paper
calculation: Percentile of proportional cover of LANDFIRE fire disturbance that wasn't high-severity occurring 1 to 5 years prior to fire/day combination within polygon representing daily burn perimeter compared to same value calculated when that polygon is located in ~500 other locations within the fire's biome, but not where the fire burned (i.e., independent of fire)

display_name:
Low/moderate severity fire fraction
(within 6-10 years ago)
source: Aggregated from DOI/USGS LANDFIRE Annual Disturbance and percentiles derived for this paper
calculation: Percentile of proportional cover of LANDFIRE fire disturbance that wasn't high-severity occurring 6 to 10 years prior to fire/day combination within polygon representing daily burn perimeter compared to same value calculated when that polygon is located in ~500 other locations within the fire's biome, but not where the fire burned (i.e., independent of fire)

source: Aggregated from DOI/USGS LANDFIRE Annual Disturbance and percentiles derived for this paper
calculation: Percentile of proportional cover of LANDFIRE insect/disease disturbance occurring 1 to 10 years prior to fire/day combination within polygon representing daily burn perimeter compared to same value calculated when that polygon is located in ~500 other locations within the fire's biome, but not where the fire burned (i.e., independent of fire)

display_name:
Proxy for length of yesterday's
active fire line (km)
source: Derived for this paper using daily FIRED events
calculation: Half the circumference of a circle with equivalent area to daily area of increase at fire's previous time step
